verbs.description: neaten (third-person singular simple present neatens, present participle neatening, simple past and past participle neatened)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make (someone or something) neat; to arrange (people or things) in an orderly, tidy way; to tidy.
examples: She made a frantic attempt to neaten her hair.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To engage in activity that arranges someone or something in an orderly, tidy way.
examples: Don't mind me if I neaten while you talk.
